content.description: Climb perfectly spaced crimps up the slab to the right of the right-facing dihedral.  Fun!
content.location: This is to the right of the right-facing dihedral on the left side of the Goal Post Boulder.

content.description: Climb the left-most slab around the left side of the boulder.  Start between two aspen trees.
content.protection: Pad and spotter.  The trees are right at the base of this problem.
content.location: This is around the left side of the Goal Post Boulder.

content.description: Climb the arete on the right-hand side of the Goal Post Boulder.
content.protection: Pad, spotter. The landing is not good.
content.location: This is on the right-hand side of the Goal Post boulder and is on an arete.

content.description: This is a great SDS that begins on nice (albeit loose) jugs and moves up on a series of slopers and pinches before a massive jug.
content.protection: Pad, spotter.  The crux is down low, so it is not too dangerous, though there are lots of rocks to hit if you fall above the crux.
content.location: It is to the right of the Goal Post Boulder on a short face to the right of a chimney.  The problem is on the far right side of this face.  There is lots of chalk down low.

content.description: Climb the overhanging arete on the left side of the Goal Post Boulder before moving right and topping out.  The holds are huge.
content.location: This ascends the left-side arete on Goal Post.

content.description: Start on small(er) holds before climbing the massive jugs up the right-facing dihedral.  Super fun.
content.location: This is on the right-facing dihedral directly left of the arete on the right-hand side of the Goal Post Boulder.

content.description: Sit start in a cave below a large but sloping rail. The crux seems to be a reachy move off the rail and pulling over the lip.
content.protection: A pad - it has a pretty decent landing.
content.location:
This is on a separate boulder right next to the Goal Post Boulder. It's to the right and a bit closer to the Roaring Fork River if you are looking at

The Goal Post

route.

content.description: Start on some sidepulls at about 5 feet that trend right, and climb the black face.
content.location: This ascends the front face of Goal Post. It follows the prominent black stream and has lots of chalk.

content.description: Climb the slab to the left of the right-facing dihedral.
content.location:
Around the left side of the Goal Post Boulder, it is to the right of

The Uprights

.

content.description:
Climb the face directly to the right of

Goal Line

.
content.protection: A pad and spotter. There are some rocks.
content.location: It is directly to the right of the big crack on the face of the Goal Post Boulder.

content.description: Climb the obvious crack in the center of the face with all the chalk on it.
content.location: It is in the middle of the Goal Post face.
